sub_topic: Calculation of standard electrode potential for a redox reaction
message_1:
Calculate the standard electrode potential for the redox reaction: 

Fe3+(aq) + e- → Fe2+(aq) 

Given that the standard electrode potential for the reduction of Fe3+(aq) to Fe2+(aq) is +0.771 V and the standard electrode potential for the reduction of H+(aq) to H2(g) is 0.000 V.
message_2: The standard electrode potential for the redox reaction Fe3+(aq) + e- → Fe2+(aq) is already given in the problem statement. It is +0.771 V. There is no need to involve the standard electrode potential for the reduction of H+(aq) to H2(g) in this case, as it is not part of the reaction being considered.
